channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The previously processed corrosive marked package was located following the OTP sort. Package was placed in front of the haz cage. Further inspection confirmed that one of the bottles inside has a defect and has caused internal release. DescribePack: Small one inch slit or defect to the body of the bottle. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Placed in haz tote and plastic bag. Placed under hood in the haz cage.

item.title: Report E-2023110113
item.description:
Report E-2023110113

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: EAST SAINT LOUIS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 13, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was damaged during transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel containerized the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The crew then deployed degreasing agent and granular absorbents to the release and worked them in using hand tools. All UN3266-impacted material was containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023100053
item.description:
Report X-2023100053

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-02
  • City: EAST ALTON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: NUMEROUS PACKAGES WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH AND HAD FROST FORMING ON THE OUTSIDE. THESE PACKAGES WERE MIXED IN WITH PACKAGES FROM THE SAME SHIPPER THAT WERE PROPERLY MARKED AS CONTAINING DRY ICE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS OF THE NON-MARKED DRY ICE PACKAGES, WE FOUND APPROXIMATELY NINE KILOGRAMS OF DRY ICE COOLING DOG FOOD IN EACH BOX. THESE THIRTY BOXES ARE MISSING DRY ICE MARKINGS ON THE OUTER BOXES. THE PACKAGES ARE GOING TO VARIOUS CONSIGNEES IN THE USA. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B37A21, PETCO-JFFD AMERICOLD, 34 FAIRMONT CITY BLVD., NATIONAL STOCK YARDS IL 62071.

item.title: Report X-2023100749
item.description:
Report X-2023100749

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: An FRA inspector observed liquid on the side of tank car # GATX 80428 appearing to be leaking from the manway cover (approximately 1/2 way down the side of the car) while performing a regulatory compliance check at the CN Glenn Yard in Chicago, IL. The inspector notified the CN Dangerous Goods Officer who responded to the incident location. The CN Dangerous Goods Officer's inspection of tank car revealed liquid leaking from the gasket sealing surface between the manway nozzle and the manway cover plate indicating a possible gasket failure. The liquid on the side of the tank car previously noted by the FRA inspector was nearing the bottom side of the tank car when the CN DGO arrived. The nitrogen pad pressure was relieved from the tank car. The manway cover was then opened for gasket inspection purposes. The (6) manway cover swing bolt nuts required a 36" pipe wrench and lubricating oil on the bolt threads to be loosened indicating the cover has not been opened for an extended period of time. The 20" manway cover lid gasket was removed and inspected. The inspection revealed the gasket to be delaminated in several areas and showed signs of deterioration throughout. The lid gasket was replaced with a 20" Teflon rim nozzle gasket and re-secured by the CN DGO. A response contractor decontaminated the tank car exterior and re-applied a nitrogen pad to the interior. The shipper listed on the waybill was notified of the incident through a Chemtrec report. The car will be released for continued transportation pending an OTMA 3 for an un-related defect.

ONE OF THE GALLONS HAD A LOOSE CAP CAUSING SOME OF THE LIQUID TO SPILL DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THIS PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A PLASTIUC BAG

item.title: Report X-2023100578
item.description:
Report X-2023100578

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on the Overgoods table after being attempted to be repacked by another Admin. Package came from Facility 608 (South Chicago). Package begun leaking again and was determined to be damaged. Package had Flammable Liquid labeling and was determined to be a Fully Regulated HazMat. Package was then taken off the warehouse floor and was isolated from the rest of the staff. DescribePack: 1 of the 6 jerrican containers inside was badly abraded at its bottom and was punctured. This led to a leak of hazardous materials out of a small hole in the bottom of the container. 2 of the other containers were also badly bent but did not begin to leak. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat Cage for isolation and processing.
